definition[0]: small things that you wear for decoration, such as rings or necklaces
example[0]: She wears a lot of gold jewelry.
explanation[0]: Jewellery is an uncountable noun and is not used in the plural You say
example[1]: The thieves stole all my jewellery
bad_example[0]: The thieves stole all my jewelleries
explanation[1]: Jewellery is always followed by a singular verb
explanation[2]: When talking about one ring, necklace etc, you say a piece of jewellery or an item of jewellery
